snippet.title: The `smaller' the school, the better? the Smaller Learning Communities (SLC) program in US high schools
snippet.description: Given the widening achievement gap between whites and students of color in US schools, Small Learning Communities have emerged as a reform measure claimed to boost achievement in general and among racial minorities. This article examines this claim by reviewing the major policy documents and literature on SLC and analyzing SLC using Frank's (1972) policy assessment criteria. snippet.title: Equal Access to State Funding: the case of Muslim schools in Britain
snippet.description: The decision to award government funding to four independent Muslim schools in Britain placed the spotlight on the issue of the public purse being used for private institutions, and also brought to an end the 15-year battle that Muslim communities waged in order to receive equality of treatment.
